otp.group6.view

Class RegisterLoginController

  • java.lang.Object
    • otp.group6.view.RegisterLoginController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class RegisterLoginController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Class is used to handle RegisterLoginView.fxml views user logging in and user registering. It communicates with the database and checks for user names, registers users and logs them in.
    Author:
    Joonas Soininen

        private void setLocalization(java.util.ResourceBundle bundle)

        Parameters:

        public void setMainController(MainController mainController)
        Method sets variable to the parameter provided from MainController.java
        Parameters:
        mainController, - is the instance of MainController.java that is in the current thread running. Makes a connection to the database and calls for a function to remind about the password

      • pwReminder

        public void pwReminder()
        Method to show a tool tip for the password field reminding about the correct way of selecting a password

      • registerUser

        public void registerUser(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Method to register the user name and password to the database if all is met correctly Method goes trough comparisons and the user name has to pass these also the password must be in correct form
        Parameters:
        event, - button push handling
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - thrown if there is a problem with the database

      • loginUser

        public void loginUser()
        Method logs user in to the system if all comparisons are met. Feedback is provided with tool tips and coloring the error areas.

      • pwIsValid

        public static boolean pwIsValid(java.lang.String password)
        Used to check for password security
        Parameters:
        password - is the inputed password
        Returns:
        true if it matches requirements

      • unisValid

        public static boolean unisValid(java.lang.String username)
        Method validates inputed user name, in this case checks for whitespace usage.
        Parameters:
        username - users inputed user name.
        Returns:
        true if user name meet the standards.
